critique: The document is an executive order focused on ensuring the integrity and effective supervision of legal and expert witness services provided to the United States. It mandates that organizations and individuals providing these services be compensated reasonably and not based on the outcome of litigation, with fees established in advance. The order applies to executive agencies, excluding the Government Accountability Office and intelligence community elements. It restricts agencies from entering contingency fee agreements unless required by law and requires them to notify the Attorney General and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget of existing agreements. The order aims to ensure fair compensation and avoid conflicts of interest in legal and expert services provided to the government.
